questions.question_text:
FILL BLANK -
After configuring printing on a Linux server, the administrator sends a test file to one of the printers and it fails to print. What command can be used to display the status of the printer's queue? (Specify ONLY the command without any path or parameters.)

choices.B: Output date and time in different formats.
choices.A: Synchronize the hardware and system clocks.

discussion.content:
B. Output date and time in different formats.
C. Set the system clock.

questions.question_text: Which of the following tasks can be accomplished using the command date? (Choose TWO correct answers.)
Which of the following are syslog facilities? (Choose TWO correct answers.)

discussion.content:
The output of the command seq 1 5 20 is: 
1
6
11
16
seq is a Linux command that generates sequences of numbers, and the arguments 1 5 20 specify the start value (1), the increment value (5), and the end value (20) for the sequence. So in this case, the sequence generated will start from 1 and increase by 5 until it reaches a value greater than 20.

questions.question_text:
What output will the following command produce?
seq 1 5 20
Which file inside the CUPS configuration directory contains the definition of the printers?

discussion.content: The file inside the CUPS configuration directory that contains the definition of printers is printers.conf or cupsd.conf.
